TopicTitle: So, top 14 Space Games you should be excited about. Guess what's on it

Articles.Content:
Of course Kerbal is on there. So is Star Citizen, a game I'm ashamed to admit I backed.

Wait, no I'm not.

Of course Kerbal is on there. So is Star Citizen, a game I'm ashamed to admit I backed.

It's a game I'm glad I didn't back... Roberts is selling the GD Eifel Tower, enjoy your disappointment. XD
I backed it too. I think there is a very good chance of a solid game coming out of it.
So is it just me, or does it seem like we are in the beginning of a sort of "Space Renaissance" in entertainment and popular media?

I backed Star Citizen for $30, but I'm not giving them anymore of my money.

The add-ons are so insanely over priced it's either going to be;

A) Dissapointing for those who paid $170 for a ship to see people who paid $30 flying that same ship 1 week after the game launches.

or

Dissapointing for those who paid $30 having to grind their way for months to be even able to crawl at the feet of the rich people who paid 4-5 times above what the average game charges.

Either way it's a misuse of crowd funding.
Wait so what's the deal with Star Citizen? What have they done that everyone is bashing them? I don't know! Fill me in!
Lets not get off topic here: if you want to discuss Star Citizen please find/create a thread in the Space Lounge

1. I didn't know that there were 14 space games.

2. Most of the aren't my bag :/

3. Star Citizen sounds good but Mr. Roberts isn't getting a dime until he delivers!

4. KSP is the best of all of the 14 games, naturally.

Yeah, I found this list through the SC forums (a game for which I've pledged Ã‚Â£70/$105 (got myself an Aurora LX and an Avenger though)). I'll admit that I wasn't thinking of KSP when I found the list, and so I had a nice surprise and thought "Why didn't I think KSP would be on this list??"

I was under the impression that it would just be games like Star Citizen and X: Rebirth. It's definitely good to see that our not-so-little space program is getting well-noticed. And to think it's been something like a year and a half since I started playing the old demo. The game has come a long way, both in development and publicity, and that's something that makes me smile inside a little bit

WOW !!!

22 million plowed into Star Citizen and there isn't even a release date yet. 2 million plowed into Elite Dangerous and they have a March 2014 release set.

I know where I would be putting my money :-)
I've been calling Star Citizen a likely scam since I first saw their site. Millions of dollars, no release date, and they keep asking for more?
Star Citizen is a bit on the shady side. I mean, I backed it, because whatever, I could, and I'd like to see it, but I fully expect a spectacular fiasco. A Vegas con is just too much.

It's a crime that Rogue System doesn't get more attention.

Calling all sim pilots! Rogue System is aiming for DCS-like levels of detail and in-cockpit interaction with all your vehicle's many systems. Forget that silly Star Citizen and back something that deserves it.

For me, KSP should be the number one on that list. It's not only the best space game, but probably one of the best games I've ever played. The other one that looks interesting is Gal Civ III. I loved the first two... absolutely amazing games.

I've been calling Star Citizen a likely scam since I first saw their site. Millions of dollars, no release date, and they keep asking for more?

Release of the space action alpha is later this year.

Some people expect a full fledged Free-Wing-Eve-lancer-Online-Space-Commander though. They will be disappointed.

@Galileo

Have to agree with you, KSP has probably absorbed more of my spare time then any other game I have played, and at 53, trust me, I have played a lot of games :-)

Don't know about the Squad team's financials, but I bet they haven't spent 22 million getting it to it's present impressive stage !
Thread closed. This isn't a Star Citizen forum..
